revised_title: Temperature Effects on Elasticities and Internal Viscosity of Metal Wires
tldr: This article investigates the effects of temperature changes on the elasticities and internal viscosity of metal wires. The authors conducted experiments on various metals, including German silver, mild steel, brass, copper, and soft iron. They found that the Young's modulus and rigidity modulus of the metals decreased with increasing temperature. The study also provided interesting insights into the rate of decay of torsional oscillations at different temperatures.
